meanings.definition: The quality or state of being toxic to the kidneys.
meanings.sent1: The nephrotoxicity of the medication caused kidney damage.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor patients for signs of nephrotoxicity when prescribing certain drugs.
meanings.sent3: The nephrotoxicity of the cleaning solution was so strong that even the pipes got damaged!
meanings.sent4: The nephrotoxicity of the situation was like a slow poison to the kidneys.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of nephrotoxicity lingered in his mind, a warning of kidney danger.

meanings.definition: The harmful effect of a substance on the kidneys.
meanings.sent1: Excessive alcohol consumption can lead to nephrotoxicity over time.
meanings.sent2: Chemotherapy drugs often have nephrotoxicity as a side effect.
meanings.sent3: The nephrotoxicity of the ice cream was that it made his kidneys scream for help!
meanings.sent4: The nephrotoxicity of stress on the body is like a silent kidney attacker.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the concept of nephrotoxicity using a simple analogy, comparing it to kidney poison.
